details.description:
Dr. Larissa Suzuki is an award-winning computer scientist, inventor, and engineer. Her professional career includes +9 years advancing many fields of computer science, including the design, development and management of large-scale highly interconnected data-driven systems.

Her PhD research has originated the Mayor of London’s "City Data Strategy", and she works at the Economic and Business Policy Unit of the GLA managing the development of digital solutions to solve London’s urban infrastructure challenges, save public money, and drive growth. She is a member of the Connected Systems Integration Committee of the IET, founder and chair of the Tech London Advocates group on Smart Cities, and reviewer of the IEEE Computers Magazine, IEEE Transactions on Signal Processing.

Dr. Larissa Suzuki will be talking about open cities at the ODI Summit 2016.

Book now
